intro: Myrsine venulosa, commonly known as the silky myrsine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Myrsine venulosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
